description: Chapters: 1/1 Fandom: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin Rating: Not Rated Warnings: Major Character Death Relationships: Arya Stark/Gendry Waters, Arya/ Gendry, gendrya Characters: Arya Stark, Gendry Waters, Gendry Baratheon - Character, Sansa Stark Additional Tags: Game of Thrones - Freeform, poemfic, Mourning, its really sad, also my first work, Gendrya - Freeform, baratheon - Freeform, Stark - Freeform, ASoIaF, luisdecamoes, Fluff My first ever published Fanfic! I hope you all enjoy it! English is not my first language so apologies for any mistakes! summary: Okay, maybe this is a bit farfetched, but I think there’s a nice bit of Gendrya foreshadowing in a Feast for Crows. When...
body:
Okay, maybe this is a bit farfetched, but I think there’s a nice bit of Gendrya foreshadowing in a Feast for Crows.

When Brienne, Pod and Hyle Hunt arrive at the Crossroads Inn, there are only two named characters there: Willow and Gendry. Willow, albeit being just a child (she’s 10) is clearly behaving much more maturely than her age. Of her, Ser Hyle says “One day that little girl will make some man a frightful wife. That poor ’prentice boy, most like.”

So, we have Gendry and a young girl working together to keep some children safe and generally survive in a country at war, and another character’s immediate response to that is “yeah, they’re probably gonna get married one day.”

Where have I seen this situation before? Damn, Brienne even wonders if Willow might be Arya in disguise. Gendrya is endgame y’all.

trail.content:
Okay, maybe this is a bit farfetched, but I think there’s a nice bit of Gendrya foreshadowing in a Feast for Crows.

When Brienne, Pod and Hyle Hunt arrive at the Crossroads Inn, there are only two named characters there: Willow and Gendry. Willow, albeit being just a child (she’s 10) is clearly behaving much more maturely than her age. Of her, Ser Hyle says “One day that little girl will make some man a frightful wife. That poor ’prentice boy, most like.”

So, we have Gendry and a young girl working together to keep some children safe and generally survive in a country at war, and another character’s immediate response to that is “yeah, they’re probably gonna get married one day.”

Where have I seen this situation before? Damn, Brienne even wonders if Willow might be Arya in disguise. Gendrya is endgame y’all.

summary: I’m sorry but can we just talk about how some of the Stark children are basically following their ancestors? Jon - Manning the...
body:
I’m sorry but can we just talk about how some of the Stark children are basically following their ancestors?

Jon - Manning the Wall that Brandon the Builder built,
        - was killed trying to save his sister Arya, Brandon Stark was killed trying to
          save Lyanna Stark

Sansa - In the Vale with the House Royce, Beron Stark wed Lorra Royce 

Arya - The Mountain Clans are planning a revolt in her name, Rodrick Stark 
           wed Arya Flint

Bran - Beyond the Wall from where the First Men are from, the Starks come
           from the First Men

summary:
Arya to Sansa after Jon is banished to the Wall: Sansa, are you ok?
Sansa: Oh, I'm fine. It's just that life is pointless and...
body:
Arya to Sansa after Jon is banished to the Wall: Sansa, are you ok?
Sansa: Oh, I'm fine. It's just that life is pointless and nothing matters. And I'm always tired. Also I can't sleep. I'm over-eating. None of my old hobbies interest me.

summary: Stop thinking that the female characters of this tv series necessarily need to have a woman or a man by their side to be and...
body: Stop thinking that the female characters of this tv series necessarily need to have a woman or a man by their side to be and feel empowered. Sansa is good off alone. Arya is good off alone. Brienne is good off alone, Yara is good off alone…K?Understood?Thanks for coming to my Ted Talk. I m sure someday some of them will want a family;but stop thinking that you’re entitled to have that from the tvseries before,and now from the books. Long may they reign or thrive wherever they are,fucking whoever they want,and having a family only if they’re interested in having one.

summary:
I really like to write about Gendrya. These two incredible characters are so inspiring and I love them so much. 
Even if, in the...
body:
I really like to write about Gendrya. These two incredible characters are so inspiring and I love them so much.

Even if, in the end, my fanfiction will probably be shit, it makes me feel good to write about them. It really calms me down.

So, thank you, GRRM, for creating Arya and Gendry. And thank you, Maisie and Joe, for playing these roles with so much talent 💛

you mean to convince me that arya biggest-visenya-targaryen-fangirl-ever stark did not fangirl over dany/drogon/rhagal????
summary: Honestly, one of the most unbelievable things about s8 is D&D expecting us to believe that Arya Stark, the same Arya Stark who...
body: Honestly, one of the most unbelievable things about s8 is D&D expecting us to believe that Arya Stark, the same Arya Stark who reamed out Tywin Lannister for not acknowledging Visenya and Rhaenys’ part in Aegon’s conquest, the Arya Stark who knew the names of Visenya and Rhaenys’s dragons, the Arya Stark who fucking SMILED like a kid in a sweet shop when Drogon and Rhaegal soared over Winterfell while everyone else was scared shitless, didn’t follow Daenerys Targaryen around Winterfell like a lovesick fangirl asking Dany every imaginable question about the dragons, Dany’s adventures, and if she could have a go on Drogon???

reblog.comment: Honestly, one of the most unbelievable things about s8 is D&D expecting us to believe that Arya Stark, the same Arya Stark who reamed out Tywin Lannister for not acknowledging Visenya and Rhaenys’ part in Aegon’s conquest, the Arya Stark who knew the names of Visenya and Rhaenys’s dragons, the Arya Stark who fucking SMILED like a kid in a sweet shop when Drogon and Rhaegal soared over Winterfell while everyone else was scared shitless, didn’t follow Daenerys Targaryen around Winterfell like a lovesick fangirl asking Dany every imaginable question about the dragons, Dany’s adventures, and if she could have a go on Drogon???

trail.content: Honestly, one of the most unbelievable things about s8 is D&D expecting us to believe that Arya Stark, the same Arya Stark who reamed out Tywin Lannister for not acknowledging Visenya and Rhaenys’ part in Aegon’s conquest, the Arya Stark who knew the names of Visenya and Rhaenys’s dragons, the Arya Stark who fucking SMILED like a kid in a sweet shop when Drogon and Rhaegal soared over Winterfell while everyone else was scared shitless, didn’t follow Daenerys Targaryen around Winterfell like a lovesick fangirl asking Dany every imaginable question about the dragons, Dany’s adventures, and if she could have a go on Drogon???

summary: Do you know what really sucks about the ending of GoT from a feminist perspective? None of the women who end up in a position of...
body:
Do you know what really sucks about the ending of GoT from a feminist perspective? None of the women who end up in a position of power have a family.

It’s the old song again: you can either be dedicated to your career as Kingsguard, adventuress or Queen in the North, or you can have a family like Gilly and become ‘invisible’ the moment the second child arrives.

The only woman to have both was Cersei.

This is why the montage of Sansa’s coronation just makes me angry and not happy.

And don’t @ me… I know this is personal. People have told me through all my professional life that I am obviously not dedicated enough because I have family, or they have told me that I am not dedicated enough to my family because I have a career.

Do you know what really sucks about the ending of GoT from a feminist perspective? None of the women who end up in a position of power have a family.

It’s the old song again: you can either be dedicated to your career as Kingsguard, adventuress or Queen in the North, or you can have a family like Gilly and become ‘invisible’ the moment the second child arrives.

The only woman to have both was Cersei.

This is why the montage of Sansa’s coronation just makes me angry and not happy.

And don’t @ me… I know this is personal. People have told me through all my professional life that I am obviously not dedicated enough because I have family, or they have told me that I am not dedicated enough to my family because I have a career.

tags: another thing d&d forgot to mention

blog.name: baratheonblue
blog.title: baratheon blue
blog.description:
ours is the fury I house baratheon

alice. 17.

summary:
gendrya headcanons:
gendry keeps a little ragged armchair in the corner of the forge that arya sits on and watches him work...
body:
gendrya headcanons:

  • gendry keeps a little ragged armchair in the corner of the forge that arya sits on and watches him work from, and they cuddle on it as the fire burns down to an ember, and then years later their child will fall asleep curled up on it with their pet direwolf.
  • arya won’t eat vegetables because “they’re gross!”, and gendry won’t eat with a knife and fork because “it’s useless!”, so dinnertimes consists of them arguing with eachother trying to get the other to eat properly. and davos just sits at the table sighing and glancing at their child sat between them, who is eating their vegetables perfectly with a knife and fork.
  • gendry makes all of arya’s weapons, and on every arrowhead he makes her he leaves a few little words of love indented. arya thinks its funny because it’s like she’s shooting love towards the game she hunts.
  • gendry gives the best piggyback rides.
  • when arya is mad at gendry she hides his smithing hammer and he has to make do with a spare one borrowed from the other smith, but it just doesn’t feel right, and then a few days later his hammer will turn up in the strangest places and arya maintains ignorance.
  • gendry making little play suits of armour for their kids, and they all go through a phase of never taking them off. gendry realises his mistake when they start sleeping in them and trys to coerce them to take them off, arya just joins in.
  • the child that looks most like arya, takes after gendry personality wise, and vice versa with their child that looks like gendry.
  • davos is the ultimate grandfather and teaches all of arya and gendry’s children to read.
  • gendry grows his goatee back and arya pretends to hate it but secretly she loves it, doesn’t mean she doesn’t tease him about it.
  • gendry making little iron and bronze toys for his kids, that kind of ends up becoming a little business for them, arya is his manager and door to door salesman.
  • they kinda become famous for the art of weaponry and lords and ladies all over westeros and even further afar send their children to come learn under both arya and gendry about fighting and weapons.
  • gendry forges a dragonglass great-sword to be the new heirloom sword, but he makes little minature dagger versions of it for the whole family.

reblog.comment:
gendrya headcanons:

  • gendry keeps a little ragged armchair in the corner of the forge that arya sits on and watches him work from, and they cuddle on it as the fire burns down to an ember, and then years later their child will fall asleep curled up on it with their pet direwolf.
  • arya won’t eat vegetables because “they’re gross!”, and gendry won’t eat with a knife and fork because “it’s useless!”, so dinnertimes consists of them arguing with eachother trying to get the other to eat properly. and davos just sits at the table sighing and glancing at their child sat between them, who is eating their vegetables perfectly with a knife and fork.
  • gendry makes all of arya’s weapons, and on every arrowhead he makes her he leaves a few little words of love indented. arya thinks its funny because it’s like she’s shooting love towards the game she hunts.
  • gendry gives the best piggyback rides.
  • when arya is mad at gendry she hides his smithing hammer and he has to make do with a spare one borrowed from the other smith, but it just doesn’t feel right, and then a few days later his hammer will turn up in the strangest places and arya maintains ignorance.
  • gendry making little play suits of armour for their kids, and they all go through a phase of never taking them off. gendry realises his mistake when they start sleeping in them and trys to coerce them to take them off, arya just joins in.
  • the child that looks most like arya, takes after gendry personality wise, and vice versa with their child that looks like gendry.
  • davos is the ultimate grandfather and teaches all of arya and gendry’s children to read.
  • gendry grows his goatee back and arya pretends to hate it but secretly she loves it, doesn’t mean she doesn’t tease him about it.
  • gendry making little iron and bronze toys for his kids, that kind of ends up becoming a little business for them, arya is his manager and door to door salesman.
  • they kinda become famous for the art of weaponry and lords and ladies all over westeros and even further afar send their children to come learn under both arya and gendry about fighting and weapons.
  • gendry forges a dragonglass great-sword to be the new heirloom sword, but he makes little minature dagger versions of it for the whole family.

tags: a song of ice and fire
love of my life queen of my heart
i'm sorry d&d did you so dirty sweetie
title: book!arya stark appreciation post
body:
• befriends people from all social classes
  • likes to listen to ned talk to his men and thinks back on his lessons about leadership
  • “arya would make friends with anybody” because she is a people person!! she’s friendly!! we stan an extroverted queen!!
  • good at math and better at managing a household than sansa
  • loves playing with babies
  • takes care of weasel and basically becomes like a mother to her even though she is only a kid herself
  • and she never says in canon that she doesn’t want to be a mother why is this a commonly held belief why do y’all seem to think that only traditionally feminine women can be moms
  • picks wild flowers for her daddy and gives them to him as a present
  • when they’re crossing the neck she counts all the kinds of flowers she hasn’t seen before
  • her naive understanding of what a brothel is (“it’s like an inn, with girls”)
  • trying to convince herself she’s totally NOT jealous of gendry possibly sleeping with bella but then she brings it up chapters later…like yeah arya you totally don’t care at all
  • growls in her sleep when she’s having wolf dreams
  • misses her home and her family
  • a true nedcat shipper
  • actually cries on multiple occasions because she is still only a young girl faced with extremely difficult circumstances, she is not emotionless, she has feelings
  • befriends lots of women and doesn’t hate femininity, just has a lot of internalized insecurity due to being bullied as a child
  • feels bad for ripping lady smallwood’s acorn dress
  • “the woman is important too!” 
  • her childhood hero was queen nymeria, a badass warrior princess of color who led her people to freedom in a new world, helped conquer all of dorne alongside her husband, defeated six dornish kings and sent them all to the night’s watch, and established absolute primogeniture in dorne
  • in acok she goes to save gendry after he’s captured and adds dunsen to her list just because he stole her bestie’s helmet
  • says she wanted to make a new pack with hot pie, gendry, lommy, yoren and harwin and is sad that they all left her
  • “what if the wolves come?” “yield.” sassmaster 
  • she’s a polyglot
  • the kitchens at the house of black and white make her think about how hot pie would’ve liked it there
  • she actually really enjoys cooking
  • “valiant ned’s precious little girl” 
  • HER name is the one that the northerners are rallying for. jon gets killed in the books FOR HER because he loves her so much. 
  • doesn’t believe that she is worthy of love and i just want to reach through the pages and hug her

book!arya is a complicated character with a complicated relationship to femininity who is so much more than a killing machine and has a deep love for her family and i just wish d&d hadn’t turned her into some emotionless, faux-feminist warrior woman who sails off on her own because they don’t know how to write complex females 

i probably forgot some things so feel free to reblog and add on

blog.name: lotsoffandomimagines
blog.title: ✎ Just Imagine It ✎
blog.description:
☆ masterlist → rules → fandom list → about → fav imagines ☆
Hi! The name’s Ace. My blog runs on requests so send them in, but read my rules and fandom list before doing so! Gifs aren't mine. OC information is in my “about” link. Last but not least, this is a safe space for everyone! Be nice to each other and let your imagination soar.

summary:
Requested by anonymous 
“My lord, you asked to see me” you announced, walking into the throne room where only Robb sat. The lord...
body:
Requested by anonymous

“My lord, you asked to see me” you announced, walking into the throne room where only Robb sat. The lord of Winterfell was so excited and so startled to see you that when he stood up from his throne he almost tripped over his own furs. The sight made you giggle a little. The great Robb Stark being so flustered that he almost slipped, it was adorable. “I hope it’s all good news” you continued after Robb regained his composure.

The man cleared his throat before running a hand through his growl curls. “I suppose that all depends on you” Robb replied. You blinked in confusion, unsure of how to take this. “There’s something that I feel I must tell you” Robb admitted approaching you before he took your hands in his own. At his touch you smiled, he never failed to make you feel ever so warm and protected. “The truth is… I’ve loved you ever since I was a boy and if you’ll have” he said before getting down on one knee. “I’d like to make you mine for forever”.

All of a sudden, your knees felt weak. This was certainly not at all what you expected when you were sent to report to the Stark son. You were so shocked that Robb eventually became convinced that you were going to deny his proposal, so he began to rise. Before he could you placed a hand on Robb’s shoulder, keeping him in place. “My lord… Robb… I love you too” you told him, happy tears welding up in your eyes. “And I would be honoured to be with you”.

The biggest smile you’ve ever seen appeared on Robb’s face in that moment. You allowed him to stand and once he was on his feet, he wasted no time in kissing you. Never before have you felt so loved but the moment couldn’t last to the ends of time. In fact, the two of you would be interrupted by cheers and three voices saying “she said yes!”. Both you and Robb looked toward the entrance to the throne room to see the rest of the young Stark children Sansa, Arya, and Bran grinning with glee at the fact that Robb’s confession had gone so well.

“Run among all of you” Robb chuckled, shaking his head at his sibling. “Go tell mother and father the good news”.

REQUESTS ARE OPEN
